intro: Lagochilus aucheri var. elegans, commonly known as the Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped, gray-green leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens with suitable climate conditions.
